TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HealthApplicationConfiguration extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Gives access to the configuration file for the application and exposes some of the settings directly.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ApplicationCertificate As X509Certificate2

Docs.summary: Gets a certificate containing the application's private key.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "SignatureCertStoreLocation", "AppCertSubject", "ApplicationCertificateFilename", and "ApplicationCertificatePassword" configuration values.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ApplicationId As Guid

Docs.summary: Gets the application's unique identifier.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "ApplicationId" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property BlobStreamUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the URL to/from which BLOBs get streamed, for the configured default instance of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HealthVaultUrl" configuration value with the path modified to the appropriate handler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ConnectionLeaseTimeout As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the application's connection can remain open before the HealthVault framework closes the connection.
Docs.remarks:
The default value is 5 minutes.
This setting only applies when using HTTP Persistent Connections .
Using this property ensures that active connections do not remain open indefinitely, even if actively used. This property is intended when connections should be dropped and reestablished periodically, such as load balancing scenarios.
Setting the property to -1 indicates connections should stay open idefinitely.
This property corresponds to the "ConnectionLeaseTimeout" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ConnectionMaxIdleTime As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the application's connection can remain idle before the HealthVault framework closes the connection.
Docs.remarks:
This default value is 110 seconds of inactivity.
This setting only applies when using HTTP Persistent Connections .
Setting this property to -1 indicates the connection should never time out.
This property corresponds to the "ConnectionMaxIdleTime" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ConnectionUseHttpKeepAlive As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the application uses Http 1.1 persistent connections to HealthVault.
Docs.remarks:
True to use persistent connections; otherwise false. The default is true.
This property corresponds to the "ConnectionUseHttpKeepAlive" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Property Current As HealthApplicationConfiguration

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current configuration object for the app-domain.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property DefaultRequestTimeout As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the request timeout in seconds.
Docs.remarks: This value is used to set the property when making the request to HealthVault. The timeout is the number of seconds that a request will wait for a response from HealtVault. If the method response is not returned within the time-out period the request will throw a with the Status property set to . This property corresponds to the "defaultRequestTimeout" configuration value. The value defaults to 30 seconds.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property DefaultRequestTimeToLive As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the request time to live in seconds.
Docs.remarks: This property defines the "msg-ttl" in the HealthVault request header XML. It determines how long the same XML can be used before HealthVault determines the request invalid. This property corresponds to the "defaultRequestTimeToLive" configuration value. The value defaults to 1800 seconds.

Docs.summary: The default number of internal retries.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: Default sleep duration in seconds.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: The default signature algorithm name.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: The default signature hash algorithm name.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: The default symmetric algorithm name.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetConfigurationString(string configurationKey) cil managed
Protected Overridable Function GetConfigurationString (configurationKey As String) As String

Docs.param: Key to look up the configuration item.
Docs.summary: Gets the string configuration value given the key
Docs.returns: String value of the configuration item, should return null if key not found.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property HashAlgorithmName As String

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the hashing algorithm to use when communicating with HealthVault.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HashAlgorithmName" configuration value. The value defaults to "SHA256".

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property HealthClientServiceUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the HealthVault client service URL for the configured default instance of the HealthVault web-service, from the application or web configuration file.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HealthVaultUrl" configuration value with the path modified to the appropriate handler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HealthVaultMethodUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the HealthVault method request URL for the configured default instance of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HealthServiceUrl" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property HealthVaultShellUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the HealthVault Shell URL for the configured default instance of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "ShellUrl" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HealthVaultTypeSchemaUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the HealthVault type schema root URL for the configured default instance of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HealthServiceUrl" configuration value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property HealthVaultUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the root URL for a default instance of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HealthServiceUrl" configuration value with "wildcat.ashx" removed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property HmacAlgorithmName As String

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the algorithm used to ensure communication with HealthVault isn't tampered with.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "HmacAlgorithmName" configuration value. The value defaults to "HMACSHA256".

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property InlineBlobHashBlockSize As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the size in bytes of the block used to hash inlined BLOB data.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "defaultInlineBlobHashBlockSize" configuration value. The value defaults to 2MB.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property MultiInstanceAware As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the application is able to handle connecting to multiple instances of the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks:
This setting defaults to true and can be set in an application configuration file, using the "MultiInstanceAware" setting key.
Applications in HealthVault can be configured to support more than one instance of the HealthVault web-service. In such a case, and when the MultiInstanceAware configuration is set to true, all redirects generated through the HealthVault .NET API will have a flag set indicating that the application is able to deal with HealthVault accounts that may reside in other HealthVault instances. In such a case, HealthVault Shell can redirect back with an account associated with any one of the instances of the HealthVault web-service which the application has chosen to support. The application may then need to be able to handle connecting to the appropriate instance of the HealthVault web-service for each account.
For more information see the Global HealthVault Architecture article.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RequestCompressionMethod As String

Docs.summary: Gets the method used to compress requests.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "requestCompressionMethod" configuration value. The value defaults is to not compress requests.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RequestCompressionThreshold As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the size in kilobytes above which requests will be compressed.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "requestCompressionThreshold" configuration value. The value defaults to 1KB.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ResponseCompressionMethods As String

Docs.summary: Gets the application's supported compression methods that can be sent back from HealtVault during a method response.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "responseCompressionMethods" configuration value. The value defaults to not compress responses.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RestHealthVaultUrl As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the root URL for a default instance of the Rest HealthVault service
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "RestHealthServiceUrl" configuration.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RetryOnInternal500Count As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the number of retries the .NET APIs will make when getting an internal error response (error 500) from HealthVault.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "RequestRetryOnInternal500" configuration value. The value defaults to 2.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RetryOnInternal500SleepSeconds As Integer

Docs.summary: Gets the sleep duration in seconds between retries due to HealthVault returning an internal error (error 500).
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "RequestRetryOnInternal500SleepSeconds" configuration value. The value defaults to 1 second.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ServiceInfoDefaultCacheTtl As TimeSpan

Docs.summary: Gets the value which specifies the period of time before the built-in cache is considered expired.

remarks.p: Default value is 24 hours. This property corresponds to the "ServiceInfoDefaultCacheTtlMilliseconds" configuration value.
The next request for the object after the cache is expired will result in a call to the HealthVault web-service to obtain an up-to-date copy of the service information.
An application can override the entire caching and service info retrieval behavior by passing its own implementation of to . In such a case this configuration is no longer applicable.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SignatureAlgorithmName As String

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the signature algorithm.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "SignatureAlgorithmName" configuration value. The value defaults to "RSA-SHA1".

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SignatureHashAlgorithmName As String

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the signature hash algorithm.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "SignatureHashAlgorithmName" configuration value. The value defaults to "SHA1".

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SupportedTypeVersions As IList(Of Guid)

Docs.summary: Gets the type version identifiers of types supported by this application.
Docs.remarks: Although most applications don't need this configuration setting, if an application calls or makes any query to HealthVault that doesn't specify the type identifier in the filter, this configuration setting will tell HealthVault the format of the type to reply with. For example, if a web application has two servers and makes a call to GetItem for EncounterV1 and the application authorization is set to the EncounterV1 format then the application will get EncounterV1 instances back even if the record contains Encounter v2 instances. Now the application wants to upgrade to Encounter v2 without having application down-time. In order to do this, one of the application servers must be updated to Encounter v2 while the other still works with EncounterV1. If we were to rely solely on application authorization one of the servers would be broken during the upgrade. However, by using this configuration value to specify what type version the server supports (rather than the application), then both servers can continue to work while the application is upgraded.
Docs.exception: If the configuration contains the name of a type that is not registered as a type handler in .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SymmetricAlgorithmName As String

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the symmetric algorithm.
Docs.remarks: This property corresponds to the "SymmetricAlgorithmName" configuration value. The value defaults to "AES256".

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property UseLegacyTypeVersionSupport As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not legacy type versioning support should be used.
Docs.remarks: Type versions support was initially determined by an applications base authorizations and/or the . Some of these behaviors were unexpected which led to changes to automatically put the and into the automatically for developers. This exhibits the expected behavior for most applications. However, in some rare cases applications may need to revert back to the original behavior. When this property returns true the original behavior will be observed. If false, the new behavior will be observed. This property defaults to false and can be changed in the web.config file "UseLegacyTypeVersionSupport" setting.
